005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.adapter;
007
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.jsonFormatVisitors.JsonFormatTypes;
009
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.AbstractDataTypeAdapter;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.MetapathConstants;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.IBase64BinaryItem;
013import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.EQNameFactory;
014import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.IEnhancedQName;
015import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
016
017import java.nio.ByteBuffer;
018import java.util.Base64;
019import java.util.List;
020
021import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
022
023/**
024 * Support for the Metaschema <a href=
025 * "https://pages.nist.gov/metaschema/specification/datatypes/#base64">base64</a>
026 * data type.
027 */
028public class Base64Adapter
029    extends AbstractDataTypeAdapter<ByteBuffer, IBase64BinaryItem> {
030  @NonNull
031  private static final List<IEnhancedQName> NAMES = ObjectUtils.notNull(
032      List.of(
033          EQNameFactory.instance().newQName(MetapathConstants.NS_METAPATH, "base64"),
034          // for backwards compatibility with original type name
035          EQNameFactory.instance().newQName(MetapathConstants.NS_METAPATH, "base64Binary")));
036
037  Base64Adapter() {
038    super(ByteBuffer.class, IBase64BinaryItem.class, IBase64BinaryItem::cast);
039  }
040
041  @Override
042  public List<IEnhancedQName> getNames() {
043    return NAMES;
044  }
045
046  @Override
047  public JsonFormatTypes getJsonRawType() {
048    return JsonFormatTypes.STRING;
049  }
050
051  @Override
052  public ByteBuffer parse(String value) {
053    Base64.Decoder decoder = Base64.getDecoder();
054    byte[] result = decoder.decode(value);
055    return ObjectUtils.notNull(ByteBuffer.wrap(result));
056  }
057
058  @Override
059  public ByteBuffer copy(Object obj) {
060    ByteBuffer buffer = (ByteBuffer) obj;
061    ByteBuffer clone = buffer.isDirect()
062        ? ByteBuffer.allocateDirect(buffer.capacity())
063        : ByteBuffer.allocate(buffer.capacity());
064    ByteBuffer readOnlyCopy = buffer.asReadOnlyBuffer();
065    readOnlyCopy.flip();
066    clone.put(readOnlyCopy);
067    return clone;
068  }
069
070  @Override
071  public String asString(Object value) {
072    ByteBuffer buffer = (ByteBuffer) value;
073    byte[] array;
074    if (buffer.hasArray()) {
075      array = buffer.array();
076    } else {
077      // Handle direct buffers
078      array = new byte[buffer.remaining()];
079      buffer.get(array);
080    }
081
082    Base64.Encoder encoder = Base64.getEncoder();
083    return ObjectUtils.notNull(encoder.encodeToString(array));
084  }
085
086  @Override
087  public IBase64BinaryItem newItem(Object value) {
088    ByteBuffer item = toValue(value);
089    return IBase64BinaryItem.valueOf(item);
090  }
091
092}
